title: Gallery Talk: Egyptian Revival Architecture Across the Globe
hero_caption: <p>Harold Allen.<em> Pyramid and Guardian Sphinx</em>, 1969. Harold Allen Egyptomania Collection: Ryerson and Burnham Library.</p>
description:
Join Mellon undergraduate fellows Margarita Lizcano Hernandez and Alejandra Vargas to learn the fascinating and odd ways that Egyptian designs and architectural motifs have been adopted throughout the world. The tour begins in the Ryerson Library with the vitrine exhibit they curated entitled Forever "Egypt"! and then proceeds to the galleries to highlight Egyptian influence in the museum.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
